authorisedkeysmc.error.server-auth-fail: The server could not prove its identity! (incorrect signature)
authorisedkeysmc.error.key-props:
Failed to load properties for the %1$s keypair:

%2$s
authorisedkeysmc.screen.no-keys-left.bod:
None of the %1$s key(s) used were authorized by the server!
The keys used were, in order:
authorisedkeysmc.screen.no-keys-left.foo:
If you have other keys available, add them to this server via the configuration screen accessible below or in the Multiplayer screen.

If not, contact a server administrator to either get unregistered or have them manually register a public key of your choosing.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.registration.pro:
Would you like to register your "%1$s" key with the server?

Key "%1$s": %2$s

Once you register, you can only join as this player if you possess the same public key.

If you do not register, this player UUID will remain open for anyone to log in as.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.unknown-server-k:
The authenticity of the server %1$s can't be established.

It has the key: %2$s

Most likely, this happened because you are joining this server for the first time.

Do you wish to continue connecting?
This key will be remembered for future log-ins.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.wrong-server-key:
The public key of the server %1$s has changed!

Old key: %2$s
New key: %3$s

This could either mean:

    a.) Man-in-the-middle attack.
    b.) An admin simply changed out the key.
    c.) A mistake on an admin's part.

If you continue, the new key will be kept.
Do you wish to continue connecting?
authorisedkeysmc.screen.config.title: Key Management
authorisedkeysmc.screen.config.keys.prop: This key is encrypted with a password.
This key is used on the following servers:
No key selected. Select an existing key or create a new one.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.config.servers.e: You have not joined any servers yet.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.title: Key-pair Creation
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.preamble:
Creating a randomly generated public/private Ed25519 key-pair.

The public key is automatically sent to the servers you configure it for. The private key is never shared and remains on disk.

NEVER SHARE YOUR PRIVATE KEYS!
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.field.en: Encrypt this key-pair with a password
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.name-tak: There is already an existing key-pair with that name!
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.encrypti:
You will need to enter the password whenever this key is used.

Passwords are never transmitted to the server and are only used to decrypt the private key for use.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.new-key.waiting: Generating key. The window may freeze for a short moment.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.delete-key.title: Confirm Key-Pair Deletion
authorisedkeysmc.screen.delete-key.promp:
Are you sure you wish to §npermanently delete§r this key-pair?

This operation is irreversible!
authorisedkeysmc.screen.decrypt-key.prom: The "%1$s" key needs to be decrypted with the correct password.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.decrypt-key.erro: Incorrect password or corrupted private key.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.decrypt-key.wait: Decrypting key. The window may freeze for a short moment.
authorisedkeysmc.screen.confirm-key.prom:
To ensure that you remember the password, the newly created "%1$s" key needs to be decrypted with that same password.

If you have already forgotten the password, you can create a fresh keypair.
authorisedkeysmc.status.waiting-for-chal: Waiting for signature challenge from the server...
authorisedkeysmc.tooltip.share-key: Copy this public key string to the clipboard.
authorisedkeysmc.tooltip.backup-key: Make a back-up of this key-pair to a file or the clipboard.
authorisedkeysmc.tooltip.forget-server:
Forget the server's public key and the list of keys used for this server.

This does not remove the server itself from your multiplayer server list.
